commText: That was an absolute humdinger. A rare loss for CSK at fortress Chepauk as LSG have toppled them twice in two games. Marcus Stoinis was the hero of the night with that stunning innings but don't forget Ruturaj Gaikwad played a breathatking innings and got a century of his own earlier. Lots of great cricket played tonight and it came down to just a few poor deliveries and a couple of misfields from CSK. So that win takes LSG up to 4th place while CSK slip down one place to 5th. That's it from us tonight then, this is Anurag Hegde signing off on behalf of Saurabh Shankar and Praveen Kumar.

Marcus Stoinis | Player of the Match: In these competitions, there are plenty of better opening batters better than me so I’ll leave it to them. It’s not just go go go, there were some bowlers we wanted to target and some bowlers we wanted to be more cautious against. There was a phase where I wasn’t able to hit the boundaries so it was great Pooran could come in and take the pressure off. Lots of ebbs and flows, just tried to keep it in control. You’re planning and structuring, you're not liking certain bowlers and you’re liking others more. I do think T20 cricket is changing, the scores that have been scored, the impact player role and how teams are taking on the bowlers. I’ve got a great relationship with the coach (Australian Head coach), me not getting a contract, I knew that long ago. It’s great to let the kids come in and get an opportunity, I’m happy to let them take my spot. But on the playing front, I’d like to play and contribute.

KL Rahul | LSG Captain: Very special, especially when it’s a game like that. We were way behind the game when we were batting so it was very special to pull it off. It was a fresh start, both teams started off at 0. Different conditions here. I think they started off really well and put us under pressure. 170-180 would’ve been a great total here but they batted really well. Full credit to Stoinis. It was not just power hitting, it was very clever batting. He picked his bowlers and played very well. (On sending Stoinis at 3) We felt like we needed to be braver and capitalize the powerplay and needed 1 power-hitter in the top-3. I’ve realized that T20 cricket has changed in the past couple of years, 170-180 doesn’t always cut it. You need to go harder in the powerplay and the impact player rule also gives you a bit more depth. (On the change to his own batting) Haven't played much T20 cricket so happy that it’s coming off. There’s no set plan, apart from the openers, everyone else is ready to go out whenever we feel it's right. We’re going to keep it flexible. (On his catch earlier) Not bad, not bad… I hope I get the catch of the tournament award (smiles), I was just being modest.
Stats by Roshan Gede
LSG No.3 this season \nFirst 7 matches: 56 off 55, six dismissals, Avg: 9.33, SR: 101.81 \nStoinis (today): 124* off 63, SR: 196.83
Most IPL hundreds in defeats 3 - Virat Kohli 2 - Hashim Amla 2 - Sanju Samson 2 - Ruturaj Gaikwad Gaikwad is the only one score a hundred in a losing cause for CSK.

Most individual hundreds in an IPL match 2 - RCB vs GL, Bengaluru, 2016 2 - SRH vs RCB, Hyderabad, 2019 2 - SRH vs RCB, Hyderabad, 2023 2 - RCB vs GT, Bengaluru, 2023 2 - RR vs RCB, Jaipur, 2024 2 - KKR vs RR, Kolkata, 2024 2 - CSK vs LSG, Chennai, 2024

Highest individual scores in IPL run-chases 124* - Marcus Stoinis (LSG) vs CSK, Chennai, 2024 120* - Paul Valthaty (PBKS) vs CSK, Mohali, 2011 119 - Virender Sehwag (DC) vs Deccan Chargers, Hyderabad, 2011 119 - Sanju Samson (RR) vs PBKS, Mumbai WS, 2021 117* - Shane Watson (CSK) vs SRH, Mumbai WS, 2018 final

Highest individual scores for LSG 140* - Quinton de Kock vs KKR, Mumbai DYP, 2022 124* - Marcus Stoinis vs CSK, Chennai, 2024 103* - KL Rahul vs MI, Brabourne, 2022 103* - KL Rahul vs MI, Mumbai WS, 2022 89* - Marcus Stoinis vs MI, Lucknow, 2023 124* is also the highest individual score against CSK in the IPL, bettering Virender Sehwag's 122 for PBKS at the Wankhede Stadium, Mumbai in the 2014 Qualifier 2.

Highest targets successfully chased in last six overs (IPL) 96 - RR vs KKR, Kolkata, 2024 92 - RR vs PBKS, Sharjah, 2020 89 - MI vs CSK, Delhi, 2021 87 - LSG vs CSK, Chennai, 2024 86 - KKR vs RCB, Bengaluru, 2019
Successful 200-plus run-chases at Chepauk in the IPL 211 - LSG vs CSK, 2024 206 - CSK vs RCB, 2012 203 - CSK vs KKR, 2018 201 - PBKS vs CSK, 2023
Highest successful run-chases for LSG (by targets) 213 vs RCB, Bengaluru, 2023 211 vs CSK, Brabourne, 2022 211 vs CSK, Chennai, 2024 183 vs SRH, Hyderabad, 2023 177 vs CSK, Lucknow, 2024

Successful 200-plus run-chases against CSK (by targets) 219 - By 4 wickets - MI, Delhi, 2021 211 - By 6 wickets - LSG, Brabourne, 2022 211 - By 6 wickets - LSG, Chennai, 2024 206 - By 6 wickets - PBKS, Abu Dhabi, 2014 201 - By 4 wickets - PBKS, Chennai, 2023

Deepak Hooda: Thoughts were pretty clear, we needed 14 runs an over, hit the ball was the plan. I don't have any option, the run-rate was like that, these guys was tough to handle, that's what IPL brings. He was too good and he was like a warrior, he was there from the 2nd over, his knock was motivation only. 100% we were in the game and the dugout was sure that we are gonna fight and win the game. These 2 points make a big difference to our team and we are in the business end of the tournament, against CSK who are playing well. It is a good feeling.

Ruturaj Gaikwad | CSK Captain: Tough pill to swallow, but good game of cricket. LSG played really well in the back end. We had the game in control till 13-14 overs, but Stoinis played a great innings. (On dew) It played a part, there was a huge amount of dew and it took our spinners out of the game. We could have otherwise controlled the game better and taken it deeper. But these are parts of the game, can’t control it. Jaddu is batting at number 4 since we lost the second wicket within the powerplay. (On Dube’s entry point) Our thinking is clear that after the powerplay if there is a wicket, Shivam will come out to bat. We can’t force batters to get out after. To be honest, I thought our target wasn’t enough, it was just about par because of the dew we’ve seen during our practice sessions. But credit to the way LSG batted.

23:30 Local Time, 18:00 GMT, 23:30 IST: Historic run-chase at Chepauk as LSG pull off a double over CSK this season! It was all about one man in that run-chase. He'd shown no real signs of being in this kind of form before tonight but when push came to shove, Stoinis stood tall and got the job done. Chasing 211, a score Shivam Dube said was about 10-15 above par, LSG got off to a poor start as they lost both openers early. It was a brutal struggle for Padikkal who came in next and LSG were firmly behind the asking rate even as Stoinis struck them cleanly from one end. Interestingly though, LSG's innings followed nearly the same trajectory as CSK's. The acceleration came right when LSG needed it as Stoinis and Pooran teed off. Pathirana got CSK back in the fold with the wicket of Pooran but the CSK bowlers, with plenty of dew out there, simply couldn't batten the hatches against Stoinis' assault. They were hurt by a couple of crucial misfields from Deepak Chahar as well and a little cameo from Deepak Hooda only aided the cause. With 17 needed off the last over, Stoinis got it done with 3 deliveries to spare. Presentations coming up shortly.

Mustafizur to Stoinis, FOUR, no there isn't! Stoinis has done it for LSG! A knock for the ages this as Stoinis single-handedly takes his team over the line! Banged in short on middle, Stoinis moved right across his stumps and pulled it away behind square on the leg-side, no one out there and it goes for four!
Free-hit coming up, 2 needed off 4, surely there's no more drama!

Mustafizur to Stoinis, no ball, FOUR, the edge flies away too and to make matters worse, it's a no-ball! Oh dear, it could not go more wrong for Mustafizur and CSK! Full toss wide outside off, Stoinis threw his hands at it and got a thick outside edge, short third man was very fine and it raced away past his right
7 needed off 4. Suddenly LSG favorites to win it

Mustafizur to Stoinis, FOUR, as straight as an arrow! First 2 balls go for 10 runs! Very full on off-stump, Stoinis stays still and deep in his crease again, somehow manages to get under this and drills it straight back over the bowler, he put his hand up but it had already passed him then, struck so hard and it split long-on and long-off
Crowd has gone dead silent, a great measure of the situation of the game

Mustafizur to Stoinis, SIX, first rock is out of here! Full and just outside off, Stoinis stays deep in his crease and this ends up being a juicy half-volley, he swings hard and sends it sailing over long-on
This is going down to the last overs folks! We've already had some I0$ thrillers, will this be another one? The Fizz to bowl, he's got 17 to defend and Stoinis is on strike
Pathirana to Hooda, 2 runs, full on off-stump, Hooda stays deep in his crease and chips it back over the bowler's head, didn't hit it cleanly and the man at long-off keeps it down to a couple
Now Hooda has a free swing here
Pathirana to Hooda, no run, nicely bowled, slower delivery and back of a length on middle, Hooda looked to make room and slap it over backward point but missed

Pathirana to Hooda, FOUR, another boundary! Very full on middle, Hooda makes a bit of room and swings hard, it goes straight down the ground and the man at long-on cannot get across to his left fast enough

Pathirana to Hooda, FOUR, oh dear, Chahar with another misfield! Very full and just outside off, Hooda looked to go up and over extra cover, got a thick outside edge and it went fine past Dhoni but Chahar had been placed very fine for just that, he got there easily but let it through his fingers! That could prove costly
Pathirana to Stoinis, 1 run, nails the yorker on off-stump, Stoinis drives it straight to cover and they'll manage a quick single
Pathirana to Stoinis, FOUR, drilled through the covers! Full and just outside off, Stoinis opened up the off-side and absolutely smoked it through the gap at extra cover, just what LSG needed
We're down to the last 2 overs. LSG need 32 and with Stoinis out there, it's hard to pick a favorite

Mustafizur to Hooda, SIX, now Hooda nails one! Just back of a length on middle from round the wicket, angled in and Hooda used the pace and angle to heave it away over deep backward square leg, just about went over the man on the ropes, he even got his fingertips to it
Mustafizur to Stoinis, 1 run, full and outside off, looked to go over extra cover but got no timing, hit the toe end and went towards wide long-off

Mustafizur to Stoinis, 2 runs, that's a hundred for Stoinis! A brilliant innings notwithstanding the eventual result of the game, he's single-handedly kept his team in the hunt, full and wide outside off, Stoinis reached out and carved it away to deep point for a couple

Mustafizur to Stoinis, no run, wide yorker executed to perfection, Stoinis had moved over outside off-stump and Mustafizur pushed it just outside the wide line, Stoinis let it go but it was never going to be a wide, review lost as well!
LSG review. Wide not called and Stoinis wants another look
Mustafizur to Stoinis, SIX, he's crunched this! Just back of a length on off-stump, Stoinis stood still in his crease before swatting this half-tracker over deep mid-wicket, he moves on to 98
Mustafizur to Stoinis, no run, slower delivery full and slanting away just outside off, big swing and a miss from Stoinis
Mustafizur Rahman [2.0-0-17-1] is back into the attack
Three overs to go, 47 to get

Pathirana to Stoinis, leg byes, 1 run, review lost but a brilliant yorker, fired in straight at the boots, tailed in a touch and Stoinis was caught in a right old tangle, snuck under the blade and struck his back boot. Pathirana was convinced, Dhoni probably not completely but they decided to go upstairs. Nothing on UltraEdge and ball-tracker shows it just pitched outside leg-stump, no wonder Dhoni wasn't so keen!
CSK review. Big shout for lbw and it wasn't given, only question is if it was going down leg

Pathirana to Stoinis, FOUR, just past the fielder! Just back of a length on off-stump, Stoinis stayed leg-side and just steered this to the right of backward point, was not very far from the man but he put it into the gap to collect four more, into the 90s now
Pathirana to Hooda, 1 run, length delivery outside off, sliced away to deep backward point
Deepak Hooda, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Pooran vs Pathirana in T20s Runs: 25 Balls: 25 Dismissals: 4 Avg: 6.25 SR: 100 4s/6s: 2/1 Dots: 11

Pathirana to Pooran, out Caught by Thakur!! Straight up in the air and taken! Pathirana delivers right when CSK needed him to. Favourable match-up for Pathirana too as he's got Pooran 4 times in T20s now. Was full on off-stump, in the slot to be honest, Pooran stood still and deep in his crease looking to launch it down the ground but it hit the toe end of the blade and went straight up. Shardul ran in from long-off and settled under it before taking a high-pressure catch. Pooran c Thakur b Pathirana 34(15) [4s-3 6s-2]
Pathirana to Pooran, THATS OUT!! Caught!!
Pathirana to Stoinis, 1 run, length delivery wide outside off, Stoinis reaches out and slaps it towards extra cover, excellent fielding as Moeen stops it with a dive to his right
Looks like the ball was changed during the break, that'll ease some of CSK's worries
Pathirana to Stoinis, no run, banged in short on middle, sharp bumper directed right at the batter, Stoinis looked to ramp it over and missed
Matheesha Pathirana [2.0-0-14-1] is back into the attack

Timeout. This game is now on a knife's edge! The camera buggy's wheels were completely wet which means there's lots of dew out there. Bowling and fielding is never easy with a wet ball so that's something CSK will have to deal with in addition to Stoinis and Pooran who're striking them very cleanly right now. 54 needed from 24 and the asking rate has come down to 13.5
Thakur to Stoinis, 1 run, gets out of the over safe but it costs CSK 20! Very full just outside off, drilled down the ground to long-off
Thakur to Pooran, 1 run, length delivery on off-stump, mistimed slap down the ground to long-off

Thakur to Pooran, 2 runs, full-toss on off-stump, Thakur gets away with this, Pooran swings hard again but gets no timing, goes up in the air and lands safely in the deep extra cover region, landed right in between 3 men
Now Thakur goes round the wicket
Thakur to Pooran, SIX, he's got hold of another one! Slower delivery full and outside off, in the slot and Pooran picked it, waited for it and sliced it away up and over deep extra cover

Thakur to Pooran, FOUR, poor fielding! That should have been stopped, wide yorker outside off, almost perfectly executed, Pooran opened the face of the bat and carved it out to deep backward point, Chahar the man there slid past it and let it through, Dhoni visibly disappointed with that

Thakur to Pooran, SIX, Pooran launches it over the ropes! Length delivery wide outside off, Pooran moved across to be able to reach this and slapped it away over deep extra cover, clean strike, 50-run stand comes up as well
Shardul Thakur [2.0-0-22-0] is back into the attack
Asking rate is almost touching 15
Mustafizur to Stoinis, no run, slower length delivery slanting across just outside off, Stoinis slices and misses, beats him with the change of pace

Mustafizur to Stoinis, SIX, in the air and out of the ground! Full on middle, this was in the slot, Stoinis backed away a little and mowed it straight back over the bowler's head, incredible how much power he got into that because his weight was going backwards and not into the shot
Mustafizur to Pooran, 1 run, very full just outside off, Pooran stays deep in his crease again and slaps it down the ground, finds long-off though

Mustafizur to Pooran, FOUR, Pooran just starting to switch gears! Very full just outside off, Pooran stays deep in his crease, manages to get under this and carve it up and over extra cover, one-bounce and four
Mustafizur to Stoinis, 1 run, good length delivery on off-stump, leg cutter and Stoinis bunts it towards cover for one
Mustafizur to Pooran, 1 run, very full just outside off, yorker length and Pooran jams it down the ground to long-on
Mustafizur Rahman [1.0-0-4-1] is back into the attack
LSG are just about hanging around in the contest and they need the fireworks to begin now. Stoinis is well set and Pooran seems to have got his eye in as well. At the same stage, CSK were 119/3
Pathirana to Stoinis, 2 runs, length delivery on middle, was a cutter, Stoinis tucked it towards deep mid-wicket for a couple
Pathirana to Pooran, 1 run, full-toss wide outside off, Pooran carves it out towards deep point

Pathirana to Pooran, FOUR, superb shot! Very full and just outside off, ended up being a low full-toss and Pooran drove it crisply past extra cover, no stopping it once it beat the man in the ring, Pooran just starting to get warmed up
Pathirana to Stoinis, 1 run, 149.5kph, low full-toss just outside off, carved away to sweeper cover for one
Pathirana to Stoinis, no run, 149kph, length delivery just outside off, Stoinis stands his ground and slashes at it before missing
Pathirana to Pooran, 1 run, very full on off-stump, very hard to get under these and Pooran only slices it out towards extra cover for a quick single
Matheesha Pathirana [1.0-0-5-1] is back into the attack

Summary (Overs 7-13) > Moeen Ali concedes six singles off his over > A 26-ball fifty for Marcus Stoinis > Jadeja and Moeen Ali slip in a couple of quiet overs > Padikkal struggles to get going, knocked over by Pathirana > Deshpande concedes 17 off his penultimate over > LSG need 96 off the last 7 overs

Tushar Deshpande to Stoinis, no run, fired into the blockhole wide outside off, kept it out of Stoinis' reach, was the right idea and the execution was good enough as well because the decision has been overturned!
CSK review. Wide was signalled but Dhoni thinks it shouldn't be one

Tushar Deshpande to Stoinis, no ball, FOUR, oh this has gone horribly wrong for Tushar Deshpande! Waist-high full-toss on middle, Stoinis swiped it away, it went high and landed safe in the deep square leg region before dribbling to the ropes, no-ball wasn't called and Stoinis went for the review straightaway, the graphics show it was indeed over waist-high so a no-ball and free-hit coming up
LSG review. They've reviewed for a waist-high full toss that wasn't called a no-ball
Tushar Deshpande to Stoinis, 2 runs, length delivery wide outside off, Stoinis throws his hands at it again and slices it out uppishly towards sweeper cover, couple more added
Tushar Deshpande to Stoinis, 2 runs, gets the wide yorker right this time, Stoinis throws his hands at it and gets a thick outside edge, goes down to deep backward point and they get a couple
Tushar Deshpande to Stoinis, SIX, superb shot! Low full-toss outside off, misses the yorker only by a margin and Stoinis generates so much power as he smacks it flat over deep extra cover
Tushar Deshpande to Pooran, 1 run, low full-toss wide outside off, carved away to deep point, struck well but not in the gap
Tushar Deshpande to Stoinis, 1 run, fired in full and wide outside off, Stoinis was moving across his stumps even before it was bowled, good ball as Stoinis can only bunt it out towards mid-off
Tushar Deshpande [2.0-0-17-0] is back into the attack
Now Deshpande is going round the wicket to Stoinis
Thakur to Stoinis, 1 run, full and just outside off, pushed down the ground to long-off
Pooran vs Shardul in T20s (before today) Runs: 34 Balls: 18 Dismissals: 5 Avg: 6.8 SR: 188.88 4s/6s: 1/4
Thakur to Stoinis, wide, slower bouncer on middle, loops over Stoinis and it's called a wide
Thakur to Pooran, 1 run, full and wide outside off, sliced away to deep backward point
Thakur to Stoinis, 1 run, slower length delivery just outside off, was an off cutter and Stoinis heaved it away to deep mid-wicket
Thakur to Pooran, 1 run, very full just outside off, knocked towards cover for a single
Thakur to Stoinis, 1 run, good length delivery on off-stump, eased down to third man

Thakur to Stoinis, FOUR, squeezed away! A bit streaky but Stoinis will take it, full and wide outside off, was past the tramline but Stoinis reached out and stuck his bat out at it, got the toe end and it just went past Dhoni's right
Shardul Thakur [1.0-0-12-0] is back into the attack
Nicholas Pooran, left handed bat, comes to the crease

Pathirana to Padikkal, out Bowled!! And he's been knocked over! Pathirana puts Padikkal out of his misery, it just wasn't happening for the young left-hander tonight as classy a player he may be. Length delivery on leg-stump, Padikkal was rooted to his crease, neither forward nor back, he fended in hope but was beaten all ends up. Leg-stump lay uprooted behind him and he trudges off. Pathirana amongst the wickets straightaway. Padikkal b Pathirana 13(19)
Pathirana to Padikkal, THATS OUT!! Bowled!!
Pathirana to Padikkal, no run, oh he plays out another dot, back of a length on off-stump, was sharp and Padikkal swayed out of the way, immense pressure on the young man, he's 13 off 18
Pathirana to Padikkal, wide, length delivery that angles away wide outside off, Padikkal threw his bat at it but it was out of his reach
Pathirana to Stoinis, 1 run, slower delivery full on middle, gently bunted towards mid-on for a single
Pathirana to Stoinis, wide, banged in short on off-stump, sharp bumper but just a touch too short, called wide
Pathirana to Stoinis, no run, full and just outside off, driven straight to cover
Pathirana to Padikkal, 1 run, wide yorker executed to perfection, Padikkal reaches out and carves it out to third man, just a single
Now what does Padikkal do? He NEEDS a boundary
Pathirana to Stoinis, 1 run, Pathirana goes for the yorker straightaway, fired in and shaping into off-stump just a touch, bunted towards mid-off for a quick single
Matheesha Pathirana, right-arm fast, comes into the attack
50-plus scores by an LSG No.3 in the IPL 52(34) - Deepak Hooda vs DC, Mumbai WS, 2022 64*(45) - Prerak Mankad vs SRH, Hyderabad, 2023 51*(27) - Marcus Stoinis vs CSK, Chennai, 20
Jadeja to Stoinis, 1 run, 50-run stand comes up, flat and wide outside off, cut away to deep point, Stoinis has done all the heavy lifting in this partnership
Jadeja to Padikkal, 1 run, length delivery outside off, slapped straight to extra cover, he'll get a single,I0$
Jadeja to Padikkal, no run, made room very early and gave away his cards, Jadeja fired it wide outside off but just inside the line, Padikkal couldn't reach it
Jadeja to Stoinis, 1 run, length delivery on off-stump, pushed towards cover for a quick single

Jadeja to Padikkal, byes, 1 run, flatter delivery on middle, Padikkal goes deep in his crease and heaves across the line, misses it completely and it just goes over the stumps, Dhoni fails to gather cleanly and they'll get a bye
Jadeja to Stoinis, 1 run, flatter delivery on off-stump, pushed down the ground to long-on and it brings up fifty for Stoinis. Very important knock this

Timeout. It might feel like LSG are well behind in this contest but at the same stage, CSK were 85/2. Stoinis seems to be at his destructive best tonight but he needs support from the other end as well. Lots of pressure on Padikkal here. He's been out of touch and isn't looking great today either. He's desperately searching for a boundary and it looks like he'll either get it or get out before long.
Moeen Ali to Padikkal, no run, flatter delivery on middle-leg, followed the batter as he made a lot of room, punched it straight to extra cover
Moeen Ali to Padikkal, 2 runs, flatter delivery on middle, intentionally worked away into that same gap at mid-wicket this time, couple more taken

Moeen Ali to Padikkal, 2 runs, tossed up full just outside off, Padikkal feeling the pressure here to go after it and he did, went for a slog and got no timing, went towards deep mid-wicket and they get a couple
Moeen Ali to Stoinis, 1 run, length delivery just outside off, cut away to deep point
Moeen Ali to Stoinis, SIX, Stoinis is in the mood tonight! Floated up full and just outside off, asking for danger with that length and Stoinis struck it clean over long-on, 96m six that

Moeen Ali to Stoinis, FOUR, struck beautifully into the gap! Full and outside off, Stoinis leans in and plays a crisp sweep shot, got it right into the gap between deep mid-wicket and deep square leg, one-bounce four and it went very flat

Jadeja to Stoinis, 1 run, flatter delivery wide outside off, Stoinis stays leg-side and has to reach out a little as he looks to slap it over deep extra cover, doesn't hit it cleanly and it's taken, it was a free-hit though
Jadeja to Padikkal, no ball, 1 run, flatter delivery on middle, worked away to deep backward square leg, oh dear, Jadeja has overstepped
Jadeja to Stoinis, 1 run, length delivery on middle, worked away to mid-wicket
Jadeja to Stoinis, SIX, there's the big hit they so desperately needed! A good length delivery on middle-leg, Stoinis gave it the charge and made it a half-volley before smoking it over long-on
Jadeja to Padikkal, 1 run, length delivery on middle, worked away towards mid-wicket for one
Jadeja to Padikkal, no run, fired in flat and angling away just outside off, Padikkal presses back to cut and misses
Jadeja to Stoinis, 1 run, tossed up full on middle-leg, Stoinis pushes it down to long-off
Ravindra Jadeja, Left arm orthodox, comes into the attack
Very tidy over from Moeen, just 6 runs off it. LSG need a lot more from these overs if they are to mount a contest
Moeen Ali to Stoinis, 1 run, flat and angled away outside off from round the wicket, Stoinis hangs back and slaps it out to deep cover
Moeen Ali to Padikkal, 1 run, fired in flat and at the pads, Padikkal looks to pull but is rushed, it goes towards fine-leg off his thigh pad
Moeen Ali to Stoinis, 1 run, dropped short and flat outside off, Stoinis punches it down to long-on
Moeen Ali to Padikkal, 1 run, very full on middle-leg, Padikkal carves it out to wide long-off
Moeen Ali to Stoinis, 1 run, tossed up full outside off, slapped down to long-off
Moeen Ali to Padikkal, 1 run, tossed up full on middle-leg, Padikkal makes a bit of room and pushes it down to long-on
Moeen Ali, right-arm off break, comes into the attack
Summary (Overs 1-6) > QDK sent packing early by Chahar > Rahul holes out after looking good > CSK keep it very tight in the powerplay
Thakur to Padikkal, 1 run, Padikkal makes room and carves the length delivery from the stumps to deep backward point
Thakur to Stoinis, 1 run, good length on off, defended square and wide of backward point
Thakur to Padikkal, 1 run, good length on middle, Padikkal flicks wide of mid-on
Thakur to Stoinis, 1 run, good length outside off, keeps a bit low, Stoinis bunts it to cover-point
Thakur to Stoinis, FOUR, this is poor bowling. Short and wide outside off, Stoinis cuts up and over extra-cover now
Thakur to Stoinis, FOUR, short and wide outside off, Stoinis cuts wide of backward point and beats deep backward point to his left
Shardul Thakur, right-arm fast medium, comes into the attack
Mustafizur to Padikkal, no run, short of length and nips back in to off, Padikkal pushes it back
Mustafizur to Padikkal, no run, full outside off, driven with a high elbow but straight to the fielder at cover
Devdutt Padikkal, left handed bat, comes to the crease
LSG have made their impact player switch - Padikkal in, Yash Thakur out.

Mustafizur to Rahul, out Caught by Gaikwad!! Straight to extra-cover. No heroics from Rahul tonight. Fullish outside off, Rahul cracks the drive and does not keep it down, Rutu is on the edge of the ring at extra-cover, takes it well. Big wicket and now CSK well on top. Rahul c Gaikwad b Mustafizur 16(14) [4s-1 6s-1]
Mustafizur to Rahul, THATS OUT!! Caught!!
Mustafizur to Rahul, no run, back of a length and rising a hint outside off, Rahul again tries to cut late and misses, flies to MSD
Mustafizur to Rahul, no run, closer to off, short of length and no room to cut, Rahul makes room and tries to thread the cut, misses
Mustafizur round the wicket
Mustafizur to Rahul, FOUR, beautiful shot. Fullish on off, Rahul gets forward and drives with class and timing, holds the pose as it purrs wide of extra-cover and mid-off
Mustafizur Rahman, left-arm fast medium, comes into the attack
Tushar Deshpande to Stoinis, no run, full on off, Stoinis shows the full face of the bat to push it back
Tushar Deshpande to Stoinis, FOUR, slower ball off-cutter outside off, sits up short and Stoinis pulls over mid-on, runs away
Tushar Deshpande to Rahul, 1 run, Rahul makes room and it's a slower ball on a good length on the stumps, flicked to deep mid-wicket
Tushar Deshpande to Rahul, 2 runs, back of a length outside off, Rahul pulls through the vacant mid-wicket area for a couple
Tushar Deshpande to Stoinis, 1 run, wide of the crease and good length that nips back in to middle, nearly sneaked through, but Stoinis defends it and takes one
Tushar Deshpande to Stoinis, no run, good length outside off, Stoinis adjusts to punch to mid-off
Chahar to Stoinis, 1 run, short of length on the stumps, defended to mid-on for one
Chahar to Stoinis, FOUR, short and wide outside off, Stoinis slashes the cut and it's wide of deep backward point
Chahar to Stoinis, no run, full on the stumps, flicked to mid-wicket and a slight fumble but they don't run
Chahar to Stoinis, FOUR, superb drive. Full on off, Stoinis gets forward and times the drive, Rutu at mid-off should have put in the dive but he doesn't and gives away four
Chahar to Rahul, 1 run, fullish on middle, flicked to deep mid-wicket
Chahar to Rahul, no run, fullish outswinger outside off, Rahul looks to loft over extra-cover, beaten as the ball flies over the outside-edge

Tushar Deshpande to Rahul, leg byes, 1 run, this is close. A good length delivery on middle stays low, Rahul pulls and misses, loud shout is turned down and CSK don't even consider the review. Will be interesting to see ball-tracking
Tushar Deshpande to Rahul, no run, back of a length outside off, Rahul mistimes the punch to mid-off and Stoinis is sent back in the nick of time
Quinton de Kock vs Deepak Chahar in the IPL Runs: 109 Balls: 86 Dismissals: 4 Avg: 27.25 SR: 126.74
Tushar Deshpande to Rahul, SIX, what a good calculated move that is. Rahul comes down the track and slashes the length ball all the way over sweeper cover, made room and put it away
Tushar Deshpande to Rahul, no run, good length outside off, Rahul chops the cut to gully
Tushar Deshpande to Rahul, 2 runs, good length and angling into the pads, flicked wide of deep backward square leg for a couple
Tushar Deshpande to Stoinis, 1 run, good length on off, Stoinis guides with an open face to third man
Tushar Deshpande, right-arm medium, comes into the attack
Chahar to Rahul, no run, wide of the crease and the full inswinger on off, Rahul flicks it to mid-on. Chahar thought he had got through Rahul there
Chahar to Stoinis, 1 run, short of length outside off, Stoinis opens the face of the bat and runs it down to third man
A wide slip and a fourth slip for Stoinis.
Chahar to Stoinis, no run, fullish outside off, nips back in a tad, Stoinis punches to cover
Marcus Stoinis, right handed bat, comes to the crease

Chahar to de Kock, out Bowled!! de Kock drags one back on. Chahar is pumped. Full outside off, angling away from de Kock who drives and the thick inside-edge falls back on the stumps. This is a common dismissal for de Kock, he has fallen like this umpteen times. de Kock b Chahar 0(3)
Chahar to de Kock, THATS OUT!! Bowled!!

Chahar to de Kock, no run, full and outside off, the outswinger now, driven to extra-cover and Gaikwad was already going to ground, stops it, seems to have hurt his hand, has a look at the fingers and is in pain
Dew already forming. A wide slip for Chahar.
Chahar to de Kock, no run, good length and on middle, hint of inswing there, tucked to mid-wicket
de Kock and Rahul are at the crease. de Kock is on strike. Chahar will open the attack
